results.title: Sex roles
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
A program designed for teenagers which examines relevant issues facing adolescence. This episode looks at sex-role stereotyping and how conditioning and assumptions made about the differences between sexes, can affect teenagers in their choice of career and their social behaviours.

results.title: The Age of reason
results.creator_credit: Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Art of the western world”.
The turbulence and restlessness of this period is reflected in the troubled history of France and Europe, in the first half of the 17th Century - Thirty Years War. The autocracy of Louis XIV was an example of the political response to disorder; the artistic response was a renewed emphasis on mathematical proportions and on compositions controlled by horizontals and verticals. Artists who followed after this included Poussin, Lorraine, Watteau and Jacques Louis David.

results.title: Masters of the Baroque
results.creator_credit: Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Art of the western world”.
Peter Paul Rubens absorbed much of the intensity of religious ecstacy and suffering portrayed by the artists working in Italy during the Counter-Reformation, excelling in the texture of flesh. Another master was Diego de Velazquez, reproducing the texture of costly materials - silks, brocades and velvet. Rembrandt’s work is examined from the perspective of the artist’s self-confidence in his ability to produce master works of art.

results.title: Yentl
results.creator_credit: Barbra Streisand, Rusty Lemorande, Barwood Films, Ladbroke Entertainment and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the short story “Yentl, the Yeshiva boy” by Isaac Bashevis Singer, this is the poignant tale of a young European Jewish woman (Barbara Streisand), circa 1904, who disguises herself as a boy in order to pursue her passion for studying holy scripture, an endeavour restricted exclusively to men in orthodox Jewish culture. As the education of women is prohibited in her society, she must keep her identity a secret. The strangely deceptive world this creates poses many challenges for this intrepid character who, in overcoming them, proves that nothing is impossible. The making of this modern classic was a milestone, not only for its main creative force, the legendary Streisand, but for motion picture history. “Yentl” marked the first time that a woman had produced, co-written, directed and starred in a major feature film.

constellations_other.name: What's in a name?
constellations_other.description: Pakeezah (1972) star Meena Kumari was not just 'the tragedy queen' of Hindi film – she also wrote poetry under the pseudonym Naaz. From famous families and stage names to gendered disguises, this Constellation explores how women have adopted different names and identities to facilitate their ambition.

results.title: Rollerball
results.creator_credit: Norman Jewison and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: The next war not will be fought - it will be played. The year is 2018. There are no wars. There is no crime. There is only “The Game”. In a world ruled by Corporations, where no-one asks questions, the vicious barbaric “sport” of Rollerball distracts the masses and satisfies their violent and potentially rebellious impulses. Jonathon E., (James Caan), is the champion Rollerball player, but in a world governed by an elite, there is no place for an individual, let alone an icon of heroic achievement. Threatened by the head of the Corporation, (John Houseman), deprived of the woman he loves, (Maud Adams), Jonathan E. must make the choice to “quit while he’s ahead” or suffer the consequences. In an arena, where there are no rules, there can only be one winner. A sci-fi thriller with a chilling climax.

results.title: The Dissenter
results.creator_credit: Bill Jersey and Barr Media Group
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Renaissance”.
This program documents the lives and ideas of dissenters who suffered death and/or excommunication in their challenge to the power of the Church. Through dramatic re-enactments you meet Jan Hus, John Wyclif, Martin Luther, Argula Von Grumbach, and others who questioned established authority. The essence of dissent is captured through interviews with modern day dissenters fighting orthodoxy.

results.title: The Warrior
results.creator_credit: Lee R. Bobker, Helen Kirstt Radin and Barr Media Group
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Renaissance”.
This thought-provoking presentation documents how the advent of gunpowder during the Renaissance brought about drastic changes in our perception of war and warriors. Beginning with the medieval knight, the glorious warrior, we see how this noble image was forever lost with the development of grander, more mechanised warfare. This program captures the new horrors of war and emphasises the relevancy of the issues during the Renaissance through interviews with contemporary experts in the field of international warfare.

results.title: The Scientist
results.creator_credit: Lee R. Bobker, Helen Kirstt Radin and Barr Media Group
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Renaissance”.
Of the profound changes that occured during the Renaissance, none shaped the modern world more than the emergence of science. This program documents the age through a study of the lives and works the scientists such Paracelsus, Copernicus, Kepler, Galileo and others who struggled to create a new vision of the world - a vision still evolving as we learn from interviews with today’s scientists.

results.title: The Prince
results.creator_credit: Bill Jersey and Barr Media Group
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Renaissance”.
Documents the lives and accomplishments of the “Princes” of the Renaissance. Discover the motivations and political solutions of leaders such as Cosimo di Medici, Prince Philip of Spain and Queen Elizabeth of England. Learn about Machiavelli, a maligned political theorist, but one of the most influential figures in the politics of his age. Furthermore, explore the Renaissance leaders legacy that continues to influence today’s statesmen.

results.title: Black rain
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Sherry Lansing, Stanley R. Jaffe and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Nick Conklin, (Michael Douglas) and Charlie Douglas, (Andy Garcia) are strangers in a strange land. They are New York City cops in Japan, chasing Sato, (Yasuka Matsuda), an escaped murderer and a member of the Yakuza, (the Japanese Mafia). Director Ridley Scott takes the viewer on nightmare journey through the exotic, violent streets of Osaka, into the very heart of the deadly Yakuza. This fascinating thriller tells of men torn by a clash of culture and crime against honour.
